intro: Stephania roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a climbing plant native to the Himalayas and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their medicinal properties. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic effects. Stephania roxburghiana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
